sub_title: Senior Researcher at ECN - Energy Research Centre of the Netherlands
summary:
Pedro Abelha has a degree in Chemical Engineering (1997), by Faculty of Science and Technology, New University of Lisbon, where he also obtained a Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering (2005).

Since September 2013 he participates in the development of knowledge and technology for thermochemical processes for large-scale efficient energy production from biomass, as a senior researcher at the Energy Research Centre of the Netherlands (ECN).

Formerly, between 1998 and 2013, he was the responsible for the core of fluidized bed combustion unit in the Zero Emissions Unit of the National Laboratory for Energy and Geology (LNEG), where he developed research in the field of energy, waste management, combustion and pollutant emissions.

In the same areas, he has participated in about 20 European and national projects. He has 23 papers published in recognized international journals with peer review and 30 papers presented at scientific international conferences.

Between 2007 and 2013 he lectured the chair of Combustion Technologies at the Faculty of Sciences of the University of Lisbon, as Auxiliary Professor. He collaborated between 2008-2012 in the Master Course of Energy and Bio-Energy of the Faculty of Science and Technology of New University of Lisbon by co-teaching the disciplines Seminar I and Energy Production from Biomass.
